Our MOF

NovNat Techâ€™s proprietary MOF, has shown breakthrough water sorption performance with unprecedented capacity and kinetics. With the capacity to capture from air at relative humidity (RH) as low as 10% the MOF is functional in any part of the world.

Our MOF specifications:

  • Green Synthesis Procedure: Utilizes water instead of harmful solvents, making it environmentally friendly.

  • Scalable and Cost-Effective: Production process is scalable and cost-efficient, ensuring widespread accessibility.

  • Lowest Heat of Adsorption: Exhibits the lowest heat of adsorption ever reported in literature, indicating exceptional efficiency in capturing target molecules.

  • Chemically Stable: Demonstrates remarkable chemical stability even after undergoing hundreds of cycles, without any degradation.

  • High Water Capacity: Capable of holding up to 60% of its body weight in water, highlighting its excellent moisture absorption properties.

  • Rapid Adsorption Kinetics: Shows exceptionally quick adsorption kinetics compared to existing adsorbent materials, ensuring swift capture of target molecules.

  • High Density: Possesses a high density, enhancing volumetric capacity and making it an efficient choice for various applications.

Tuning our Nov-4 Group of MOFs:

We have successfully fine-tuned our NOV-4 MOF material at different inflection points to optimize its performance in three key applications: heat pumps, atmospheric water generation (AWG), and dehumidifiers. Our tailored MOF demonstrates enhanced heat exchange capabilities in heat pumps, rapid water vapor adsorption and desorption for efficient AWG, and exceptional moisture removal efficiency in dehumidifiers. By adapting NOV-4 MOF to suit the specific needs of each application, we have maximized its potential to address various environmental challenges and advance sustainable technologies.

Maximum Water Uptake (gH2O/gads) Inflection point (Po/P) Atmospheric Water Generation Heat pump Dehumidification
Nov-04.1 0.61 0.06 arid area with moderate amb temp cooling temp below 5oC Super dry condition required
Nov-04.2 0.6 0.1 arid area with moderate amb temp cooling temp below 5oC dry condition required
Nov-04.3 0.59 0.15 semi-arid area with moderate amb temp cooling temp below 10oC moderate condition
Nov-04.4 0.58 0.2 high amb temp with RH>20% cooling temp below 15oC moderate condition
Nov-04.5 0.55 0.25 high amb temp with RH>30% cooling temp below 15oC moderate condition
Nov-04.6 0.54 0.3 high amb temp with RH>40% cooling temp below 20o No heating for regeneration is required

Our MOF-System integration:

Form factor/ shaping is a persistent major challenge in commercialising MOFs. NovNat has two ground-breaking form factors:

  • MOF ink

    Introducing MOF ink, a game-changing method for shaping MOF materials. By creating a specialized MOF slurry, this innovative approach allows for coating intricate heat exchanger geometries while maintaining exceptional material performance. Unlike traditional methods that often result in up to 50% loss of material performance, MOF ink ensures mechanical stability throughout the coating process, guaranteeing optimal performance retention.

  • Intrinsic matrix

    Leveraging the ultra-high density of MOF to produce a flake-shaped structure that offers exceptional mechanical stability without compromising material performance. This intrinsic shaping factor is particularly crucial for applications where coating is unnecessary, ensuring sustained performance integrity.

These shaping factors revolutionize MOF integration into diverse adsorption systems, making significant strides in the field. Their versatility is game-changing, allowing seamless application across various uses and offering potential enhancements for existing adsorbent materials.
